RefParameter.Name: tgfx_crc

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: CRC must be enabled for TouchGFX to run on STM32 microcontrollers.

RefParameter.Description: You must enable the CRC in order to run TouchGFX on STM32 microcontrollers.

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_fmc_unsup_data_size

PossibleValue.Comment: Unsupported FMC Data size. Only 16bits is supported.
PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Unsupported FMC data size. Must be 16bits

RefParameter.Description: Unsupported pixel format

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_ltdc_unsup_px_format

PossibleValue.Comment: Unsupported LTDC pixel format. L8, RGB565, RGB888 and ARGB8888 are supported.
PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Unsupported pixel format. Must be L8, RGB565 RGB888 or ARGB8888

RefParameter.Description: Unsupported pixel format

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_ltdc_layers

PossibleValue.Comment: TouchGFX only uses Layer 0 (2 Layers enabled).
PossibleValue.Diagnostic:
TouchGFX applications only utilize a single layer.
An additional layer can be used with TouchGFX if managed manually.

RefParameter.Description:
TouchGFX applications only utilize a single layer.
An additional layer can be used with TouchGFX if managed manually.

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_ltdc_window

PossibleValue.Comment: Layer 0 Start/Stop values must be greater than 0
PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Check Layer 0 Window settings

RefParameter.Description:
The LTDC window size is 0 because width and/or height is 0:
Layer 0 Window Horizontal Stop - Layer 0 Window Horizontal Start = Width
Layer 0 Window Vertical Stop - Layer 0 Window Vertical Start = Height

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_ltdc_image

PossibleValue.Comment: Width/height values must equal LTDC Window width/height
PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Image width and height should match window settings.

RefParameter.Description:
Image width and height should match the Width and Height
calculated from window settings.

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_ltdc_alpha_constant

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Alpha Constant should be > 0 (255 usually).

RefParameter.Description: Alpha Constant should be > 0 (255 usually).

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_display_interface
RefParameter.Description:
The display interface specifies the communication between the frame buffer in TouchGFX and the display.
Choosing Custom Display Interface gives the ability to supply your own implementation of display interface.

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Only available if Parallel RGB (FMC) is enabled.
Only available if Parallel RGB (LTDC) is enabled.

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_fmc_bank_id
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the selected FMC Bank Id.

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Enable by selcting NE1 as Chip Select for the FMC configuration 1 already configured as LCD Interface with a valid data size
Enable by selcting NE1 as Chip Select for the FMC configuration 2 already configured as LCD Interface with a valid data size
Enable by selcting NE1 as Chip Select for the FMC configuration 3 already configured as LCD Interface with a valid data size
Enable by selcting NE1 as Chip Select for the FMC configuration 4 already configured as LCD Interface with a valid data size
Enable by selcting NE2 as Chip Select for the FMC configuration 1 already configured as LCD Interface with a valid data size
Enable by selcting NE2 as Chip Select for the FMC configuration 2 already configured as LCD Interface with a valid data size
Enable by selcting NE2 as Chip Select for the FMC configuration 3 already configured as LCD Interface with a valid data size
Enable by selcting NE2 as Chip Select for the FMC configuration 4 already configured as LCD Interface with a valid data size
Enable by selcting NE3 as Chip Select for the FMC configuration 1 already configured as LCD Interface with a valid data size
Enable by selcting NE3 as Chip Select for the FMC configuration 2 already configured as LCD Interface with a valid data size
Enable by selcting NE3 as Chip Select for the FMC configuration 3 already configured as LCD Interface with a valid data size
Enable by selcting NE3 as Chip Select for the FMC configuration 4 already configured as LCD Interface with a valid data size
Enable by selcting NE4 as Chip Select for the FMC configuration 1 already configured as LCD Interface with a valid data size
Enable by selcting NE4 as Chip Select for the FMC configuration 2 already configured as LCD Interface with a valid data size
Enable by selcting NE4 as Chip Select for the FMC configuration 3 already configured as LCD Interface with a valid data size
Enable by selcting NE4 as Chip Select for the FMC configuration 4 already configured as LCD Interface with a valid data size

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_vsync
RefParameter.Description:
TouchGFX applications are driven, or ticked, by internal or external events like interrupts from an LTDC,
external peripheral or hardware timer.

LTDC is only available if enabled.

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Only available if LTDC is enabled.

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_hardware_accelerator
RefParameter.Description:
Specifies whether ChromART (DMA2D) Graphics Accelerator is used by TouchGFX or not.

DMA2D provides hardware acceleration for graphical operations.

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Only available if ChromART (DMA2D) is enabled and if selected pixel format is supported.

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_nemap_accelerator
RefParameter.Description:
Specifies whether NeoChrom (GPU2D) Graphics Accelerator is used by TouchGFX or not.

GPU2D is a graphics accelerator that is capable of accelerating many of the drawing operations in TouchGFX including texture mapping. It supports framebuffers in RGB565, RGB888, and ARGB8888 formats.
For better graphic performances, GPU2D should always be used if available.

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Only available if NoOS or ThreadX middleware is enabled.

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_custom_width
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the width of the frame buffer.

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_custom_height
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the height of the frame buffer.

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_ltdc_width
RefParameter.Description:
Specifies the height of the frame buffer.
To modify this value, go to "Multimedia" -> "LTDC" -> "Windows Position" -> "Layer 0 - Window Horizontal Stop", and "Multimedia" -> "LTDC" -> "Frame Buffer" -> "Layer 0 - Color Frame Buffer Line Length (Image Width)".

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_ltdc_height
RefParameter.Description:
Specifies the height of the frame buffer.
To modify this value, go to "Multimedia" -> "LTDC" -> "Windows Position" -> "Layer 0 - Window Vertical Stop", and "Multimedia" -> "LTDC" -> "Frame Buffer" -> "Layer 0 - Color Frame Buffer Number of Lines (Image Height)".

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_framebuffer_stride
RefParameter.Description: Enable this to use a greater framebuffer stride (width) than your actual display width. This can optimize the data transfer for some display interfaces.

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: The specific value should be the result of your display width rounded-up to the closest multiple of 64 (e.g. display width = 800 and framebuffer stride = 832)

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_framebuffer_stride_value
RefParameter.Description:
Specifies the width of the frame buffer stride.
Warning : This number should be the result of your display width rounded-up to the closest multiple of 64 (e.g. display width = 800 and framebuffer stride = 832).

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_framebuffer_stride_value
RefParameter.Description:
Specifies the width of the frame buffer stride.
Warning : This number should be the result of your display width rounded-up to the closest multiple of 64 (e.g. display width = 800 and framebuffer stride = 832).

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_pixel_format
RefParameter.Description: The Pixel Format of the application framebuffer(s).

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_pixel_format
RefParameter.Description: The Pixel Format of the application framebuffer(s).

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Enable by setting FMC Data size to 16.

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_pixel_format
RefParameter.Description: The Pixel Format of the application framebuffer(s).

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Enable by setting FMC Data size to 16.

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_pixel_format
RefParameter.Description: The Pixel Format of the application framebuffer(s).

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Enable by setting FMC Data size to 16.

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_pixel_format
RefParameter.Description: The Pixel Format of the application framebuffer(s).

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Enable by setting FMC Data size to 16.

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_pixel_format
RefParameter.Description: The Pixel Format of the application framebuffer(s).

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Not available when using LTDC.
Not available when using LTDC.
Not available when using LTDC.
Enable by setting LTDC Layer 0 to L8.
Enable by setting LTDC Layer 0 to L8.
Enable by setting LTDC Layer 0 to L8.
Enable by setting LTDC Layer 0 to L8.
Enable by setting LTDC Layer 0 to RGB565.
Enable by setting LTDC Layer 0 to RGB888.
Enable by setting LTDC Layer 0 to ARGB8888.
Enable by setting LTDC Layer 0 to ARGB8888.

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_buffering_strategy
RefParameter.Description:
Specifies the strategy TouchGFX should use to render frames.

Double Buffering eliminates any risk of tearing regardless of how long it takes to render the next frame since a TFT controller, for example, always has access to the latest complete frame data. Single Buffering can eliminate the need for external memory (tearing may occur).
Partial Buffering eliminates the need for external memory while still allowing a large portion of internal memory to be used for things besides framebuffer.

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Not available if LTDC is enabled

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_location
RefParameter.Description:
Memory location of the frame buffer.

Selecting "By Allocation" will create an array called framebuf. The placement of the array is decided by the linker.
The array has been given the section name TouchGFX_Framebuffer which is can be used in the linker script to determine the location.
Using this option together with "Double Buffer" option will place the two framebuffers sequentially in memory.

Selecting "By Address" will require a memory address to be specified, this memory region must be addressable by the MCU when
the MX_TouchGFX_Process(void) function is called.
Using this option together with the "Double Buffer" option allows each frame buffer to be placed at a specific memory address rather than being placed sequentially.
It is the user's responsibility to ensure that the addresses used does not overlap in regards to the framebuffer size.

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_address1
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the start address of the frame buffer.

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_address2
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the start address of the second frame buffer, if double buffering is enabled.

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_number_of_blocks
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the number of blocks to allocate in memory for frame buffer parts.

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_block_size
RefParameter.Description:
Specifies the size of each block of the partial frame buffer in bytes.
Default block size is calculated using: max(width, height) * bits per pixel * 3
Minimum block size is set to: max(width, height) * bits per pixel

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_block_size
RefParameter.Description:
Specifies the size of each block of the partial frame buffer in bytes.
Default block size is calculated using: max(ltdc width, ltdc height) * bits per pixel * 3
Minimum block size is set to: max(ltdc width, ltdc height) * bits per pixel

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_partialfb_transmit_strategy
RefParameter.Description:
Enable Partial Framebuffer VSync support.
To avoid visual tearing on the display only transfer frame buffer blocks when the LCD Active Update Line has passed the last line of the block in display memory.

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_datareader
RefParameter.Description: Enable Data Reader support.

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Graphics Acceleration is not supported. Set Graphic Acceleration to None to enable the Data Reader feature.

RefParameter.Comment: External Data Reader: Memory base Address
RefParameter.Name: tgfx_datareader_mem_base_address

RefParameter.Comment: External Data Reader: Memory base address
RefParameter.Name: tgfx_datareader_mem_base_address
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the start address of the external data reader memory.

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_datareader_mem_size
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the size of the external data reader memory.

RefParameter.Comment: External Data Reader: Line Buffer size
RefParameter.Name: tgfx_datareader_block_size
RefParameter.Description: Creates two buffers used when images or text needs to be blended into the framebuffer. Default value is one screen width*4 bytes to support full size images in 32bpp pixel format.

RefParameter.Comment: External Data Reader: Line Buffer size
RefParameter.Name: tgfx_datareader_block_size
RefParameter.Description: Creates two buffers used when images or text needs to be blended into the framebuffer. Default value is one screen width*4 bytes to support full size images in 32bpp pixel format.

RefParameter.Comment: External Data Reader: Line Buffer size
RefParameter.Name: tgfx_datareader_block_size

RefParameter.Comment: External Data Reader: Minimum DMA transfer size
RefParameter.Name: tgfx_datareader_dma_transfersize
RefParameter.Description: Set minimum required bytes to start DMA transfer. If fewer bytes are requested, DMA will not be used.

RefParameter.Comment: External Data Reader: Minimum DMA transfer size
RefParameter.Name: tgfx_datareader_dma_transfersize
tgfx_vector_rendering
RefParameter.Description: Enable Vector Rendering Support. CWR Vector rendering (Software) or GPU2D (Hardware).

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: GPU2D must be enabled.

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_vector_fonts
RefParameter.Description:
Enable Vector Fonts Support.
Remember to select the Vector Font option in the Typographies pane of TouchGFX Designer if you want to use this feature.

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_fmc_base_address
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the start address of the FMC Bank Register.

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_video
RefParameter.Description: Enable Video Decoding. LibJPEG (software) or JPEG (hardware).

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Libjpeg must be enabled
JPEG IP + RTOS + DMA2D must be enabled.

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_video_strategy
RefParameter.Description: Video decoding strategy. The required buffer is calculated depending on video dimensions and framebuffer format.

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Decode directly into framebuffer
Decode using a single buffer. Requires FreeRTOS.
Decode using two buffers (best performance). Requires FreeRTOS.

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_video_buffer_format
RefParameter.Description: Format of the video buffer used for decoding. ChromART can convert all formats, so choosing e.g. RGB565 on a 24-bit application could save some memory.

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: RGB565 video buffer.
RGB888 video buffer.
ARGB8888 video buffer.

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_video_streams
RefParameter.Description: Number of videos decoded concurrently. E.g. having two video widgets on the same screen.

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_video_width
RefParameter.Description: If using more than one video in the application, the decoding buffer should be wide enough for the widest video. The width determines the linebuffer, and must be divisible by 32.

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_video_height
RefParameter.Description: If using more than one video in the application, the decoding buffer should be tall enough for the tallest video.

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_oswrapper
RefParameter.Description:
Specifies the Real-Time Operating System to use.
  • No OS: implements a simple synchronization between application and TouchGFX framework.
  • CMSIS V1: uses CMSIS V1 interface to synchronization with TouchGFX framework, please provide CMSIS V1 implementation layer or enable corresponding FreeRTOS CMSIS V1 Middleware.
  • CMSIS V2: uses CMSIS V2 interface to synchronization with TouchGFX framework, please provide CMSIS V2 implementation layer or enable corresponding FreeRTOS CMSIS V2 Middleware.
  • ThreadX: uses AZRTOS ThreadX interface to synchronization with TouchGFX framework, please make sure to enable AZRTOS pack and use the ThreadX Core module.
  • Custom: provides an empty oswrapper interface which needs to be implemented.

Further information is available at:
support.touchgfx.com/docs/development/touchgfx-hal-development/generator-how-to/touchgfx-al-configuration/driver

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Only available if FreeRTOS and ThreadX are disabled.
Only available if FreeRTOS CMSIS V1 is selected.
Only available if FreeRTOS CMSIS V1 is not selected.
Only available if AZRTOS software pack is enabled.

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_tx_mem_allocation_method
RefParameter.Description:
Configured ThreadX Memory Allocation Method is Dynamic Allocation.
To modify this value, go to "Middleware" -> "ThreadX" -> "Memory Configuration" -> "Memory Pool Allocation".

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_tx_mem_allocation_method
RefParameter.Description:
Configured ThreadX Memory Allocation Method is Static Allocation.
To modify this value, go to "Middleware" -> "ThreadX" -> "Memory Configuration" -> "Memory Pool Allocation".

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_tx_mem_allocation_method
RefParameter.Description:
Configured ThreadX Memory Allocation Method is Dynamic Allocation.
To modify this value, go to "Middleware" -> "ThreadX" -> "Memory Configuration" -> "Memory Pool Allocation".

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_tx_mem_allocation_method
RefParameter.Description:
Configured ThreadX Memory Allocation Method is Static Allocation.
To modify this value, go to "Middleware" -> "ThreadX" -> "Memory Configuration" -> "Memory Pool Allocation".

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_app_mem_pool_size
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the size in bytes of the memory pool for TouchGFX Application.

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_app_stack_size
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the size in bytes of the stack memory for TouchGFX Application.

RefParameter.Name: tgfx_nema_cl_size
RefParameter.Description:
Specifies the size in bytes of the Command List buffer used by the GPU2D.
The recomended default size of the GPU2D Command List buffer is 8 kbytes.
